availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas B. McIntire (Edmonson County, KY, circuit court clerk)

body.p: Edmonson County, Kentucky, circuit court clerk. Kentucky native. Son of Rawleigh McIntire and Malvina Enlows McIntire. Married to Angeline W. McIntire. Father of Tandy L. McIntire. Farmer in LaRue County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned five enslaved persons in LaRue County in 1850. Circuit court clerk in Edmonson County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Edmonson County in 1860. Circuit court clerk in Edmonson County in 1861. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private from June 24, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, LaRue County, Hamiltson, p. 400A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, LaRue County, Hamiltons, p. 20.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, p. 109.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, p. 2A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, Precinct 1, p. 383B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Hardin County Marriages, Film 000390788, p. 154.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers Who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0013.
"Thomas B. McIntire (1828-1909)," Find A Grave, Memorial 48081662, accessed March 3, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/48081662.
